answers.answer: HiRecurrent fungal infections are generally a sign of depressed immune function.  It is most commonly seen in persons with diabetes or cancer, or who are infected with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).  Women on oral contraceptives and people taking antibiotics or obese and/or who perspire heavily are at higher risk as well.You should get yourself screened for the presence of any of the above conditions.It is difficult to diagnose any skin lesion without being able to see the lesions. Hence it is important for you to consult a dermatologist for proper treatment. Tinea capitis (scalp ringworm) infections are difficult to eradicate completely and may require oral anti-fungal treatment.Take care

title: Fungus on my head
